thread.title: Mariners stung by Hornets in regular-season finale
thread.title_full: Mariners stung by Hornets in regular-season finale

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Mariners stung by Hornets in regular-season finale
text:
Mariners stung by Hornets in regular-season finale Oceanside appears locked in 10th and final playoff spot in Class B North By Staff | Oct 14, 2015 
Turner â€” The up-and-down regular season that has been for Oceanside field hockey ended on a down note as the Mariners traveled to face Leavitt on Tuesday, Oct. 13. 
The relatively-young Mariners and Hornets were deadlocked 1-1 late in the second half, but the hosts pumped in the game-winning goal with just over two minutes left in regulation en route to a 2-1 win to cap the regular season. 
Ainsley Meklin scored for Oceanside, off an assist by Makayla VanBlarcom, while Ashley Mathieu and Kaitlyn DeBlois scored for Leavitt. 
Leavitt held an 8-5 edge in shots, while Oceanside held a 3-2 advantage in penalty corners. Mattie Hooper made five saves in the cage for the Mariners, while Hailey DeMascio made four saves in goal for the Hornets. 
Oceanside was without starting defender Alexis Mazurek and goalie Lauren Hoppe, both nursing injuries. 
The Mariners appear to be locked in the 10th and final playoff spot in Class B North and likely will travel to face No. 7 Nokomis of Newport in a prelim playoff game, probably on Saturday, Oct. 17. 
Nokomis beat Oceanside 2-1 on Sept. 24 in Rockland. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (5-8-1, 27.0663 points) is 10th, while Gardiner (12-2, 134.0816 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs.
